text: Map of Scottish local government divisions prior to the 1974 reforms. Local elections were held in Scotland in 1973, as part of that years wider British local elections. The municipal elections, held on 1 May, saw Labour doing reasonably well; increasing their majority in Glasgow and becoming the largest group on Perth council for the first time. Labour also maintained its 18-17 leader over the Progressives in Dundee. Simultaneously however Labour also failed in its attempt to gain a majority in Edinburgh. ==Municipal Elections Aggregate Results== ===Municipal Breakdown=== {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" | Council !
